summary: The Bipartisan Tax Fairness Act of 2025 proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It primarily focuses on modifying income tax rates, making certain expiring rates permanent, and establishing a new top income tax rate. The bill includes revised tax brackets and rates for various filing statuses (married filing jointly, heads of households, single filers, married filing separately, and estates/trusts). Additionally, it addresses inflation adjustments and makes conforming amendments related to tax withholding. The effective date is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
